content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

For example, if the current time is 2018-10-25T09:46:07, the output of `timezone_bumper(dt)` should be 2018-10-25T12:46:07.
```julia
dt = DateTime(2018,10,25,9,46,7)
@assert timezone_bumper(dt) == DateTime(2018,10,25,12,46,7)
dt = Date(2018,10,25) # wrong type
timezone_bumper(dt) #> ERROR: MethodError: no method matching timezone_bumper(::Date)
```
